Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Where would someone likely bring an attache case? Choices:  A: overhead compartment B: chair C: hospital D: in shirt E: business meeting<n><n>### Response:		<n>**D**<n>### Explanation:<n>An attache case is usually associated with the military and it would rarely be found in an office; instead, it would likely be worn over the shoulder while traveling in case it had to be used as a weapon.<n><n>### Input<n>How much of the following equations is correct in terms of parentheses?<n><n>$$(x+3)(x-12) = 54$$<n>I. x + 3<n>1. x + + 3<n>2. x + x + x.3<n>3. x + +12<n>4. x + +3<n>II. x - 12<n>1. I am confused about this part as well...<n>2. x -12<n>3. -12<n>4. -12<n>3.(1-5)+10+(6+5)=16<n><n>### Instructions<n>Choose one of the following operations, and identify the operation by making a true statement about parentheses.<n>I. Parent.hesis.<n>II. Parenthes(is)es<n>III. ()hparenthesesi<n>IV. (i)parenthesesi<n>V. (h)parenthesesi.<n><n>#### 2(5) + 3(4) =<n>A. 6(1) B. 12 <(5)<n>C. 8(3) D. 30(3)<n><n>#### (6)(2) + 4(6) =<n>A. (5)(30) B. 9(9)<n>C. 3(15) D. (18)(18)<n><n>#### (3)(2) - 5(6) =<n><n>A. 2(6) B. 9 <(3)<n>C. 15(3) D. (6) <(5)<n><n>#### (9)(1) * (9)(2) =<n><n>A.(9)(1) B.(15)(1) C.(18)(2) D.(30)(3)<n><n>A. (6)(12) + 2(28) =<n>B. 6 * (12) + 14<n>C. 12 * 2 + 14<n>D. 6 (1*12) + 6 (

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What country has with the capital of Amsterdam has a Fortis bank? Choices:  A: netherlands B: utrecht C: brussels D: belgium E: denmark<n><n>### Response:		Amsterdam, Netherlands<n><n>### Input<n>The Fortis bank is located in the Netherland.<n><n>### Response<n>The correct choice is A.<n><n>### Input How much does a gallon of gas cost?<n><n>### Response 3.50<n><n>### Instructions<n>Tapanga wants to buy a gift for her grandfather. How many dollars is Tapanga worth?<n><n>### Instructon:Answer the questions.<n><n>### Dearmon:<n>Input: How much does a gallons cost?<n><n>## Rationales:<n>1/3 gallons of gas cost $25.<n><n>### 2<n>Answer: 25<n><n>### Input :If 100 square inches have a 3.50 price, what is the price of a square inch if you reduce the number of squares by 10?<n><n>### Rationales:<n>To make the answer, we simply divide 3.50 by 100: so each square inch has a price of $35/100 = <<$35/10=0.35>>0.35 dollars.<n>### 0.35<n>Answer: 0.35

They are place money on counter, demand satisfaction, spend money, and pay merchants with real money.<n><n>Input: Write a multiple choice question.<n>The choice from the question has 9 letters. What letter is in the 6th position?<n>Rationales :<n>S : 9 letters in 1st position.<n>S = R : R = R + S = S + R is the choice<n>```<n>S = R, R : 1st choice<n>```<n>P : 6 letters in 2nd position.<n><n>R = R+S is the choice<n><n>M : 5 letters in 3rd position.<n><n>C : 6 letters in the 4th position.<n>A : 9 letters in the 6th letter.<n><n>#### A<n>Answer: A<n><n>Input: The choice from the question has a 1st position<n>The choices has a 3rd position<n>The choice has a 5th position.<n><n>The 1st,3rd,5th character is equal to B-I-N<n>What is the total position of B-I-N?<n>Rationales<n>```bash<n>bin<n>B : 2nd<n>C : 5th number<n>bin<n>```<n>#### 7<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write two different expressions to represent the following scenarios:<n>A boy with 18 balloons that is sharing 15 of them with a friend.<n>He still has 3 left for himself!<n>Input: A boy has 18 balloon and shares them with a friend. But still has 3 left on his own. how to express this with 2 different expression.<n><n>#### First Exp :<n>```<n>The number of balloons with a friend is 15<n>The number left for him is 15-(15/18)<n>The number left for the boy is 18-15<n>18-(15-15)<n>18-(2x15)-15<n>18-30-15-18<n>43x15-24<n>690<n>```<n><n>```<n>The number left for himself is 15-(8/18)<n>```<n><n>#### Second Exp:<n>Input  = 18+6(15)<n>

How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Many addicts turn to exercise to deal with their addictions, this is because it is a healthy way to do what? Choices:  A: condition heart B: expend energy C: laugh D: stretch E: weigh<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Demostration:<n>**Citation**: [Addy, J. A., & Shield, D. L. (2017). The role of mindfulness in the relationship between substance use and exercise. Addictive Behaviors, 69, 151-154.](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0306460316301574)
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:A shop will give you what for your purchases? Choices:  A: botanic garden B: flower garden C: backyard D: supermarket E: outdoors<n><n>### Response:		If you are looking for various varieties of roses, go to a flower garden or botanic garden. These places are filled with a wide assortment of various kinds of roses that a normal supermarket could likely not offer.<n>While a backyard garden is likely to offer a variety of traditional roses, it probably would lack a selection of the more exotic varieties. <n>A typical supermarket might have a selection of two to three different varieties of roses. Of course, they will most likely be available everywhere, but may not be available in as large a selection as is found at florist shops, flower gardens and botanic gardens.<n><n><n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:If one sees a fox and is standing in a landlocked, southern state, where is this person? Choices:  A: at the zoo B: south carolina C: hen house D: louisiana E: arkansas<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Input<n>### Demonsttation<n>### Rationale<n>### Answer:<n>### Input:Write an expression for this situation.<n><n> 5000 + 154 + 3 = x<n><n>### Demostration<n>### Answer: Write an expression for this situation 344+15<n>### Input: If x is a number, then x + 14 = -x. Write an expression for this statement. <n><n> -x + 15 = 0<n><n>### Response<n><n>### If x is a number and x + 1415 = -x. <n><n>x + 14 = 0<n><n>Rationale:<n><n>For example, if x = -1, then x + 5 = -x + 5 or 0 = 4.<n><n>For another example, if x = 1, then x +14 = -x + 14 or 0= -15.<n><n>And so on. The key is that whatever it is that x is, if the sum of x and 14 is -x but x +14 is 0 then x(minus the 14) equals zero.<n> <n>Answer:<n><n>### Question: Which function is represented by the following table?<n><n>  -1, -1, -1<n>  -12, -12, -2<n>  -22, -22, -3<n><n>Function A<n><n>### Option1 <n><n>a1=1/2×-12−1/2×-22−3/2×-32<n><n>### Option2 <n><n>\[ f(\cdot)=x-\frac{x-2}{2}-\frac{x-3}{2}-3 \]<n><n>### Option3 <n><n>\[f(x)=\sum_{i=1}^{-\infty} i\]<n><n>### Option4 <n><n>\[y=f(x)=2\sqrt{x-1}+\sqrt{x-0.5}+\sqrt{x-1}\]<n>### Rationale:<n><n>This is what I can do by hand:<n><img src="./img/22125645452000000.jpg" alt="

Choices:  A: do crossword puzzle B: see art C: give up D: grocery shop E: play chess<n><n>### Response:		B is the only appropriate choice. Crossword puzzles, art, and grocery shopping do not help with boredom. Playing chess or giving up may help with boredom, but they are not the best options. A dictionary cannot be used to play chess or to give up, so they are also not appropriate responses.<n><n>### A wordy question<n><n>### The question:<n>Which sentence below best uses commas to set off the nonessential information from the essential information?<n>Input:I love to eat vegetables. I try to include a few in most of my meals. <n>A)I love to eat vegetable. I try to include them in most of meals. <n>B)I love to eat veggies I try to include them a few in most of meals<n><n>### You decide: Is A better?<n><n>### I think: A is better <n><n>### Why you may be right: B is better because the nonessential information does not interrupt the essential information. A is redundant and causes the reader to have to reread the entire sentence.<n><n>### Why I may be right: A is much more direct and the reader does not have to reread. A contains more commas than B.<n><n>### Other responses that you may be able to make: <n><n>### C) I love vegetables. I try them most of meals.<n><n>### D) I love to eat vegetables, which are nutritionally good, including a few in most of the meals I eat<n><n>### A. B. D.<n><n>### C. D:

He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Whether it's popped, grilled, or canned people like to what? Choices:  A: expect to die B: believe in god C: stay in D: watch movies E: eat corn<n><n>### Response:		<n>C<n><n>Input:Whether it'st popped, grilledCanned people like to what :<n><n>### A: expect to dieB: believe in godC: stay inD: watch moviesE: eat corn<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:How can buildings like the Empire State building be described? Choices:  A: small B: underground C: high D: huge E: tall<n><n>### Response:		We can classify a building as either tall or huge or underground because it is made of concrete and underground.<n><n>### Rationale: Concrete is used to build roads and other infrastructure. <n><n>### Answer: Underground<n><n>### Input : What is the value of 123 / 4 + 67<n><n>### Rationales:<n>123 * (4 + 67) is equivalent to 123 * 95.<n><n>#### 11901<n>Answer: 11589<n><n>### Input<n><n>The equation ____ + 30 = 28 is true because:<n><n>### Demo<n><n>_ _ = 0 <<n><n>_:______<n><n>28 = 8+20<n><n>_ = 0 <<n>_ + 8 = 3+8 (or _ = 3) < 28 < _ or _ = 3<n><n>### Rationals<n><n>#### 9<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### RATIONAL_3_MASKED<n><n>### RAT__MASK__4_DIGIT_B<n><n>#### 1299<n><n>### PREP_PRO_T_MADE_2<n><n>### RATA_LAT _ B 24<n><n>### R _ T _<n><n>#### 1493<n><n>### PAT_MAG_2_04<n><n>### 6 _ _ _ 5<n><n>#### 158<n><n>### R 1 _ _<n><n>### 2014<n><n>### P 2 91<n><n>### 4<n><n>The rationals are:<n>9, 12, 24, 25, 26, 28, 30, 31, 32, 41, 42, 43, 44, 46, 51, 52, 53, 54, 55, 58, 60, 62, 63, 64, 66, 68, 71, 72, 75, 76, 78, 80,

How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:They were competing in basketball, the goal was to what? Choices:  A: bounce the ball B: competition C: have fun D: race E: score points<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Input:(Tapanga and Corey) <n><n>### Response (Demonstration: Tapanga has ____)  <----<n><n>### Demostration: Tapanga + Corey = _____<n><n>### Response : 29<n><n>### Demosration: Freddie's Bill : <n><n>### Responde: 10<n>                        <n>### Input:(Lawrence) <n><n>## Input:Lawrence work on 5 days a week<n><n>##  Output: 5 hours a day<n><n>## Demostration: <n><n>### Input(Ali)<n>### Output: 600 books not sold <n><n>## Demostaration: Ali Books not sold: <n><n>## Answer for Ali Books not sold : 600<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What are you hoping to do when listening to an expert speak? Choices:  A: learning B: fatigue C: mercy D: empathy E: anxiety<n><n>### Response:		Choice E: anxiety<n>- A: Learning:  You have to understand what you are learning, you can't keep it in your mind.<n>- B: Fatigue: You will get bored if you have to learn something. In my opinion, fatigue happens when you are sleepy.<n>- C: Mercy:  Everyone knows the purpose of empathy, but no one talks about how to become empathetic instead of annoying. <n>- D: Empathy: As you talk to someone, always be able to see where they're coming from. <n>- E: Anjxiety: You can never know who you will have to deal with.

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. Choices:  A: cash register B: desk drawer C: pay envelope D: throw away E: box<n><n>### Response:		The clerk must put the check into the customers pay envelope if it is for them<n><n>### Demension:<n><n>### Instructions:<n>1. Enter one of the possibilities to check for<n><n>### Inputs:<n><n>### Rationales:<n>A person writes a check and goes to get in line behind one or more customers. He or she then drops the check into the basket. When I put my items on the counter, the clerk puts the check in an envelope which will come back with my change. (It does not need to stay in that envelope, the clerk can then place it in the envelope.) This means that the check goes to a pay envelope. The clerk does not throw away or place it away.<n><n>### Options:<n>* In the drawer of a desk<n>* In the cash register<n>* In another pay envelope<n>* In a small box on the counter<n>* On the counter<n><n>#### A<n><n>Answer:<n>A person writes check to a clerk who puts them in a pay envelope if they are for them or they pay at the checkout.<n><n>#### B<n><n>Answer:<n>The clerk does not put a check into the drawer because he would not know if the check was for a customer or not.<n><n>#### C<n><n>Answer:<n>I have never seen a clerk put on a customer's checks into a pay envelope. If he did, the check is most likely for him. <n><n>#### D<n><n>Answer:<n>Most cashiers put a check in an envelope because they do not have a clue to whom the check is from, <n><n>#### E<n><n>Answer:<n>Never. <n><n>### Response<n>A Check does not go into a clerk’s back pocket. It goes into the cash register.<n>A Check goes into a box or some other place because it might be mistaken for a real check by the clerk.<n>A Check goes in a register because it could be put into a cashier’s drawer.<n>A Check goes to customer’s pay envelope if the check is for them or they pay.<n>A Check goes on the counter because it could be placed into a cashier drawer. <n><n>## ANSWER PAGE <n>

Choices:  A: contagious B: wrong C: last forever D: painful E: blind<n><n>### Response:		This response has been adapted from one previously given.<n><n>#### Answer: C<n><n>### Input : What is love when everyone keeps ____________. Choices: A: contagious 2B: wrong 3C: last forever 4D: painful 5E: blind<n><n>##  Respuesta : Esta respuesta ha sido adaptado de una respuesta previamente entregada<n><n><br /><n>**Answer: C**<n><n>**Explanation (in English)**<n>Love has the power of lasting for a long time, or forever. We can love again, but the first love, that remains in our heart is still there as it has not come to any end.<n><n><br />A: This is incorrect as there are a lot of things that can be "contagious", this is not limited to love.<n><n>B: This is not valid as to be "wrong" something has to be wrong.<n><br />C: "Last forever" is a good sentence to describe love.<n><n>D:  Love is not "painful". It can hurt at times, but it is not painful.<n><br />E: This is not valid because we can not see what "blind" is and love is defined only by the people who feel it. Therefore, we can not blindly say that it "lasts forever".<n>

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Billy bounced the ball off the wall.  There was a target on the wall for him to bounce against.  Where might he be? Choices:  A: pool table B: toy box C: playroom D: park E: closet<n><n>### Response:		<n>[Answer choices]<n>  * A: The pool table<n>  * B: The toy box<n>  * C: The playroom<n>  * D: The park<n>  * E: The closet<n> ![Answer](./answers/answers1.png)<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:what do you do before going to party? Choices:  A: call 911 B: enjoy yourself C: get drunk D: having sex E: meet new people<n><n>### Response:		<n>if your answer is a or b,then answer is correct<n><n>### Output:<n>if your answer was a, then your answer correct.<n>if your answer is b, then your answer is correct.<n>if your other answer,then answer is not correct.<n><n>###  If your answer is A,then it is incorrect<n><n>###  if your answer is B,then it is correct<n>###  If you answered C,then you are correct<n>###  if answer is D,then your answer is incorrect<n>###  if you answer E,then your answer is correct<n><n># if your answer is B or C,then all choices are correct<n><n>### If you answer D or E<n><n>### Answer Choices were incorrect.<n><n># if your other answer,your answer is not correct.

He felt that he'd ruin his relationship with Jen if he took it further, and he didn't want to do that.  At the same time,  He fight that pushing farther might do what to something good? Choices:  A: found B: destroy C: construct D: fix E: produce<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n><n>### Explanation:<n>A: James is afraid of destroying his relationship with Jen if they <n>proceed with their relationship.<n>B: James does not view a situation a a good or <n>negative thing.<n>It’s best to say that his relationship with Jen has been “constructed” (it hasn't been destroyed/fixed).<n>C: James doesn’t want to have a negative relationship.<n>James views himself as a person  that produces positive situations.<n><n>####  D<n>Answer:  D<n><n><n><n>### Instructions:<n>The following statements can be found online. Do you agree or disagree with the statements? Click "Agree" or "Disagree" to complete the response.<n><n>1. All muffins contain eggs.<n>2. A man cannot make breakfast without eggs.<n>3. Some fruit contain eggs.<n><n>#### Agree<n><n>Answer:  Disagree<n><n>#### Disagree<n><n>Answer: Disagree<n><n>### Explanaition/Reason:<n>1. All mufins contain eggs.<n>If we say all muffins contain eggs, we'd be saying that all muffins contain muffin.  Then we'd say that all birds contain eggs.<n>Muffin is the category for the muffins.  The fruit and eggs can fit into the muffin category as muffins, but not as the bird category.<n><n><n>2. A man can make breakfast withoueggs.<n>The statement says that a man can make a brekafast without eggs.  <n>This statement can be false because the man who'd make a brekafast could be a women.<n>In other words, women can make a brekafulth. <n><n><n>3. Some fruids contain eggs<n>The statement implies that fruids is a category where "contains eggs" is a property. If we add "eggs" into the category fruids it's wrong.  Adding "some" changes the statement into "fruits that contain eggs".<n>It's an untruism statement.<n><n>####  Disagree<n>Answer: Disaggre<n><n>### Instructiions to the Response:<n>Below are the steps to solve a task. Write a solution that follows the instructions, but in your own words.<n><n>

How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. Choices : A: see king B : hello C: meow<n><n>### Instructions: Find the pattern<n><n>### Instructioon:Write the number of each pattern to the right of the pattern.<n><n>### pattern:<n><n>### Demostation: 11.4.92.4.1.18.2.1.1<n><n>### answer:<n><n>### Input : Write an integer as a product of the given primes.<n><n>### Demo: 1, Write 4 as a product of 2 and 2. 1, 2, 4<n><n>### The output is: 1, 10, 20, 40, 20.9<n><n>### The rationales for the input, the output is:<n><n>### Output: the total is 4 times the quotient<n><n>### Answer: <n><n>### Input The input is : 1740496481<n><n>### Demstration: 17, 4, 0, 4, 8, 7, 3, 6, 2, 6, 1, 9<n><n>### Rationales: This number can be written as the product of the given prins<n><n>### The sum is the quotient plus 1<n><n>### Answer  : 17 * 8 * 3 * 2 * 6 * 3 + 1 = <<17*8*3*2*6*3+1=17581>>17581<n><n>##Input A number as a product of its prime factors, and the sum of their squares.<n><n>##Rationals: 16 * 5 * 3 * 3 * 5 * 5 = 124<n><n>##The sum of the squares of the prime factors is: 2 * 8 * 6 * 6 = 100 <n><n>##Answer:<n><n>##Input Input a decimal as a product of the givne primes.<n><n><n><n>##Rationales: First convert to exponent of 2: 0.991 = 0.99 *1<n><n>##Now take a product:1 * 0

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Turkey is a nation in what part of the world? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Johnny and bill fought over money.  Johnny wanted it to be over.  What might he choose to do? Choices:  A: control people B: settle everything C: buy food D: increase power E: kill bill<n><n>### Response:		<n>Rationales: A) control people <n>if there is 2 then he need more people to control or take the first place.<n><n>if there is 3 then he need more people or he needs a way to control the people already under his command.<n><n>if there are 4 or more, he need control his people or get more people and control the people together.<n><n><n>B) settle <n>if there is just him and they fighting over the money<n><n>if there is only him and a team who is against him and his people<n><n>if there are more his people and his team then he will need to settle with them<n><n>if everyone else is there. he will need to settles with them and get them into his team.<n><n>c) buy food <n>if there is little food<n><n>if there is enough food<n><n>if everyone is starving<n><n>d) increase power, if the enemy has a lot on power he will need to get a lot of people with power.<n><n>if there not any enemy then he will need to be on a good start<n><n>if their is more people with power in the team the enemy has then he will  need to get more or find a way to reduce them<n><n>If they are not there.<n><n>Him and the enemy have little power <n>He needs to get people with power and defeat the evil enemy<n>e) kill bill <n>if 3 or more people are there other then themselves and there are only few people of his team<n><n>or if there is only few people with power <n><n>In any case, we  will need to defeat the enemy and get what we want.<n><n>#### 3<n>Answer: a<n><n>

Then, write your answer here: <<30=X>>X<n><n>Demonstration: x = $6248 divided by $16<n><n>x = 6248, because it is the total amount spent<n><n>Rationales:<n>$16 is 100 c, then $6248 is 22% of $\$16$, because of this, there is 50 c over the 16.<n>$16 - 50 = $11.4 c<n>$6248 - 11.40 = 6137.6 c

He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Where is a ferret getting lots of attention likely to be found? Choices:  A: trouser leg B: sick bay C: own home D: petting zoo E: mother's hair<n><n>### Response:		<n>The correct answer is: A<n><n>I chose choice A: trouser leg because ferrets are known to be sneaky and would like to come anywhere but out on their own as they like to go around and are not like cats that will stay in one same place on the street.<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Demorstation<n><n>### Response<n><n>The correct answer is : D<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:The animals weren't good at swimming, so it was hard for them to do what? Choices:  A: pass water B: bathe C: listen to each other D: feel pleasure E: reproduce asexually<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions:The animals weren’t good at swimming so it was hard for the to pass. water<n>### Rationale:  You can’t pass water when you can’t swim.<n><n>### Answer: B<n><n>### Input :The animals weren’T good at swimming, So IT was HARD FOR THEM to Do WHAT? Choices: A: Pass water B: Bathe C: listen to Each other D: feel pleasure e: reproduce Asexually<n><n>## Instructions: The animals weren’t<n>good at swimming, so<n>it was hard for them to pass water.<n>

Choices:  A: shelf B: cellar C: refrigerator D: cupboard E: grocery store<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Input: We were having a canned good drive and I needed to get some contributions. Where did I go? Choice:<n>A: shelf,<n>B: cellar,<n>C: refrigerator,<n>D: cupboard,<n>E: grocery store.<n><n>### A: shelf<n>We needed to collect canned contributions for a food drive.<n>The shelf was near the living or dining room so would be the most convenient choice.<n><n>### B: cellar<n>The food drive's contribution was to collect canned goods in the cellar under the house.<n>The cellar provided the most appropriate opportunity to collect contributions because it was often more central than the cupboard, grocery store, refrigerator or other places.<n><n>### C: refriger<n>As it was below 0 degrees outside, the refrigerator was the least appropriate location to make contributions to the canned food drive.<n><n>### D: cupboard<n>Cupboards aren't as effective since they are often far from where people live and are often far away from where they are.<n><n>### E: grocery shop<n>Grocery store canned goods are too high in price, so they would not allow the group enough profit to get as many canned goods collected as desired.<n><n>A: shelf<n>B: cellar<n>C: refrigere<n>D: Cupboard<n>E: Grocery shop<n><n>#### 2<n>Answer: 2

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:The wheel was loose, and threatened to fall off when they were what? Choices:  A: footloose B: sailing C: fast D: tighten E: bind<n><n>### Response:		A: footloose<n><n>### Input<n>#### Input: When Mary got home, she saw the front gate ajar. But the garden door was locked at the top and bolted at the bottom. The door was, so to speak, in a ____. Chooses:  A: bind B: bind C: bind D: bind E: bind<n><n>#### Response: A: bind<n><n>## Input:<n>#### Input: 1.) Write an expression to find the cost for a carpet cleaner that can clean 100 square feet of carpet. 2.) Write an expression that computes a total cost to clean 300 square feet of a carpet. 3.) Write an expression that shows the cost for a window cleaner that can clean 200 windows.<n>#### Response: 1.) $10 2.) $30 3.) $10<n><n>## Input: <n>#### Input: A dog house consists of nine blocks: a 4-block foundation, a 1-high back, a 2-tall wall, and a 1-high roof. The back and the wall are double high. How many blocks are in the dog house if one block of any size is not equal to another? Choices: A: 5 B: 12 C: 21 D: 27 E: 30<n>#### Response: A<n><n>## Input: Write expressions equaling what?<n><n>The following example represents two questions. A complete response completes both.<n><n>Input:<n>The sum of two consecutive even numbers is the same as the sum of four consecutive even numbers. Find another even number after the sum is one greater than twice the first even number added to the sum.<n>Rationales:<n><n>The sum of two ____ is the same as the ____.<n>The sum of ____ is the same<n>The sum of _____ is the same.<n><n>We want _____ to be the sum of the next even number after _____.<n><n>The last three letters in the second equation must equal the first three letters in the third equation.<n><n>#### 1) Response:<n>The solution is 46.<n><n>#### 2) Response:<n>46 and 150.<n><n>### Example:<n>1.) In a 100-point test, the difference between the number of points the lowest
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:The teams were evenly matched when competing against one another, what did spectators want to find out? Choices:  A: envy B: resentment C: winning or losing D: one winner E: two winners<n><n>### Response:		A: The spectators were hoping to leave with their own conclusions, they were envying the other teams and were jealous that they had won.<n><n>### Input : In one game, team Red won 61, team Green lost 64, team Blue lost 0 and team Diamond tied team Orange. How did each team do? Choices: A: won B: lost C: tied D: one team won and one team lost E: two teams won<n><n>### Response :<n>All Red, Green and Blue teams would have lost the game and only Red team would have won the remaining game. Diamond team would have gone for a tie to avoid losing<n><n>### Input What happened to Henry at the end of the story? Choices: A. He felt sorry for himself and blamed himself for his mother's death. B. He felt thankful for the money and decided to donate the money to charity. C. He felt upset and used the money to build a big mansion. D. He kept saying, 'Wow, what a beautiful day' all the way home.<n>### Response : He felt happy that he had done something good and decided to donate. <n><n>### Input Where was Henry when he fell? Jack competed in volleyball and made the Olympics.D. Jack practiced for months, but his foot was broke the night before the Olympics.<n>### Response: <n>D, Jack practiced for months but injured his foot the night before the Olympics, so he couldn’t participate.<n><n>### In your opinion, which is the greatest hero in Star Wars? However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. The heavy red ball cannot roll into the blue, because it is heavy and unavailable for a long time. The heavy blue ball cannot roll into the empty light blue ball, because it is heavy. Can I fill the light blue ball with a liquid heavier than water, which is 1.25kg/L?<n><n>### Response<n>The red ball will fill the light blue ball, if the light blue ball weighs a little bit. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What could there be in a beauty salon? Choices:  A: city B: strip mall C: clerk D: neighborhood E: rooster<n><n>### Response:		B<n>#### B<n>Answer: B<n><n>### Input for:<n>### Choice:<n>A:  Tapanga's brother<n>A:  the school<n>A:  bungalow<n>A:  Corey<n>A:  cliff<n>A:  gym<n>A:  dough<n>A:  a man<n>A:  the city<n>A:  46<n>A:  Jill<n>A:  mall<n>A:  the country<n>A:  a clerk<n>A:  the police station<n>A:  a beauty barber salon<n>A:  the office<n>A:  the salon<n>A:  22<n>A:  Freddy<n>A:  an airport
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What feeling might propel one to instituting civil action? Follow steps (precedence).<n><n>  - Step 1: First, I'll enter the number of "Letters" (words).<n>  - Step 2: Then, I'll enter one character. Then I have to keep going until I write the last character (word) and stop.<n><n>2. Read in a text (or number) and store it in memory (word).<n><n>3. Split() the number/words (if the text is a number, we gonna do nothing/stop).<n><n>  - if spliting is wrong, the program or algorithm will give error and will stop.<n><n>  - if step 2 was ok, then we pass to step 3.<n><n>4. Read the first character (word) and keep doing with the rules of step 3, for all characters (words).<n><n>5. If the number of words exceeds the maximum number of words (character), error (code): "Sorry, the number of words entered was exceed 24".<n><n>  - We need to give information (error and exit) after each step is done, this is to let us know if all steps has been successfully done.<n><n>  - we need to

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. It sold a total of 219 books. How many weren't sold?<n><n>### ResponseThe bookstore sold 219 books - 90 more than it had. Choices:  a) the inverse of f  b) the composition of f and g  c) h  d) g o<n><n>### Demostration:Input:g = 112  f = 3x <n><n>### Rationales:a) The inverse of g is not defined, because g(3) = 15 which is an undefined value.<n>b) The composition of g and f is defined, because g(f(x)) = 112 * 3x = 112x<n>c) The value of h on x = 3 is 217. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:The woman experienced great joy, but despite that this was a what? Choices:  A: misery B: sadness C: bad time D: sorrow E: play time<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### B<n><n>#### A<n>

If John wants to ride his bicycle faster, he should consider wearing clothing that is more aerodynamic.<n><n><n>### Input 5. You can't rely on the question to give you a better idea of what the correct response would be. Here you have the sentence, "Soap water was used instead of the chlorine at the pool." And it is your job to find out what the author was thinking. It is your job to figure out what the author meant.<n><n>If you had any doubt about the methodology, well you don't. You had to have read something about this.<n><n>There are only 5 possible answers. Since the sentence begins with "So", we can immediately eliminate the B, C, D and E choices. B = So she didn't want to smell perfume C = But she didn't like to swim D = So she wasn't fond of swamps E = So the puddle was disgusting So the answer is A, perfume.<n><n>A good strategy is to eliminate two answers and then pick the answer that is left. This question is no different. Now that you know the answer.<n><n>### Next Tests<n><n>### Test 11
