She gave half of her marbles to Corey, who has some more than Tapanga. How many marbles did Corey take?<n>Rationales::The marbles that Tapanga has in her container now is 109/2 = <<109/2=55>>55.<n>The marbles that Corey has in his container now are  59   +  55 = <<59+55=114>> 114  <n>So we got that Corey had 114.<n>#### 114<n>Answer: 114<n><n>### Input:(A: Dad says I can watch 2 hours of television. B: Dad says I need to help mom with yard work. C: Dad calls my friends in the neighborhood. D: I can go to the park E: Dad says I'm not staying home and I'm 4 years old.<n>Response: (E)<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:If I am a person, I have a unique ability to do what? Choices:  A: cross street B: stand upright C: speak spanish D: speak chinese E: further education<n><n>### Response:		<n>A. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:To properly instruct children attending school you would need a great deal of what? The most important lesson that a person would use to educate or instruct someone about a subject is patience.  Patience is what allows you to endure the time you would need in order to educate someone. You also would need to be patient when answering all of their inquiries. Although you may be excited to be instructing someone you must try not to bore them with too much information that they are already aware of. So they have to be patient with you also. Time goes by very quickly in a person's life so it is important to teach your students that time is valuable and each second counts. So, one thing a person would not need to instruct anyone with something is time. Time itself can not be taught or instructed onto someone because it goes by whether or not you instruct it or not. All students do not want the same thing from their teachers so that a teacher would have to be inspired from teaching everyone or every student in a class. Inspire is a difficult word to define but you would probably explain to them what inspired you and why you did something and so on and so forth.<n><n>The correct answer is C because if he spent too much time and he is very good at teaching he would cause boredom by all of his students in a class room.  So, D would be the best answer. You should also include "boredom" as one of the possible answers.<n>So, it is not that you have no time to spend but that you have to make sure what you are planning on teaching will keep interest. Also, you would not have time to bore each student with the same thing that interest them and if you are trying to instruct them then they will be more bored then they would normally be when you are teaching them.<n>#### 545<n>Answer: 223<n><n>### Input:"One hundred times five equals," A: B: C: D: E: Two Hundred and Fiftieth<n><n>### Response:" Two Hundred and Sixty"<n><n>### Comment:<n>A. It's a multiple choice question.  You give the students one of the possibilities.  You tell them to put a number that will make (the chosen statement) true.  If you choose to answer D. and tell the students to enter only the answer, then you are not giving them the correct guidance.<n><n>#### 20<n>Answer
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:The person put on lotion, what did they want? Choices:  A: fresh smell B: good credit C: smooth skin D: fresh produce E: headache<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### C<n>Answer: C

He often struggled with managing money so why did he still give away his weekly paycheck? Choices: 1. because he trusted his uncle to help out 2. he did not have much expenses 3. he was happy to help out friends B: 4. he had extra money C: 5. he never kept money to himself D: 3 E: 1 F: 3 G: 4<n><n>### A<n><mark>A. He often struggled to manage his finances so why did he still decide to give his entire paycheck away every week?</mark><n><n>### Response<n><n><mark>He did it because he trusted his boss to help his friends who needed his help and because he knew his boss would pay his bills. </mark><n><n>#### A because he trusted his week to help out his friends and because he knew his week would pay his bills<n><n>#### B<n><n><mark>B. He was happy to help out his friends because:</mark><n><n><mark>1. His friends often needed help to support their families, which he wanted to do.</mark><n><n><sup>1. His friends helped him when he had a rough childhood, so he always tried to help out others when they were in need. </sup><n><n><mark>"He wanted to repay them for all the kindness they had shown him when he was a kid."</mark><n><n>#### B He was happy to help his friends because<n><n>#### 1 because he always knew that someone was there for him when he needed help<n><n>#### C<n><mark>C. He also did it because:</mark> <mark>2. He knew he was able to make more money from working overtime, so he did not really have a problem to spend his money on bills.</mark><sup>2. He decided to give away his paycheck because it was easier for him to spend the money he earned by working overtime.</sup><n><n><sup>"I have to work overtime to pay my bills and I am not able to pay my family right now."</sup><n><n>#### C. He also did it so he could<n><n>#### 
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:I am looking to buy honey right from an apiary, where should I go? Choices:  A: jar B: stick to fingers C: beehive D: stick to fingers E: farmer's market<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Input<n>B: stick to fingers<n><n>### Instructions and Demonstion<n><n>The correct answer is D: stick to fingers<n>Rationale: <n>We can use clues for each answer and use the information to our advantage. For A and B, we know that these are in honey jars, so we would not have to stick to fingers to get out the jar, thus, this is out of the question. Similarly, for C and D, we know that bees are inside these sources of honey and we have to get to them, therefore, we would not get to stick to the fingers (because bees will sting you). For E, we know that it would be far from an apiary, therefore, we can not get to the stick to fingers for honey.<n><n>### Answer<n><n>D: stick to fingers<n>

Choose the best answer to each question.<n><n>#### Demonstration: <n>Input: What is the value of 321*2 + 222*3 + 443 + 555*4 - 999*5 + 667*6 + 778*7 - 889 + 998*8 / 7<n>Rationales: First, divide each numerator and denominator by 7. We find that 321 * 2 + 223 * 3 + 44 * 4 + 101 * 5 - 15 * 5 + 79 * 6 + 67 * 6 + 78 * 7 - 34 * 8 + 123 * 8 / 7 = <<321*2+223*3+44*4+101*5-15*5+79*6+67*6+78*7-34*8+123*8/7=459>>459.<n><n>Since an integer cannot be expressed as a division of integers, we are forced to round. Since 7.0 exists and 6 has 2 digits, the least digit that can be rounded after.0 is the digit 6 in the 7th place (or decimal place).<n><n>In summary, 459 / 7 = 66.142857. The value in scientific notation is 6 + 614285.719231*105 / 7<n><n>### 66.1<n>Answer: 66.1

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What do rich people like in terms of bagels? Choices:  A: poor B: sleepy C: plain D: needy E: homeless<n><n>### Response:		Let the letter represents the option, so the options are E, A, B, C, D.<n><n>### Rationales: Rich people are able to have better choices of food or they should be able to afford every bagels that they want. They seem to not really care about what happened to the people who made the bagels. A. In rich people, they have a preference to have bagels that are poor. This is because, rich people seem only enjoy having and having so much things that they can afford. Having something that is poor, is quite interesting because many people would want to try and eat it. Rich people are not caring about homeless people because, rich people can afford to have many things that are better, so there is no reason why they have to care about homeless people. B. In rich people, They have a preference for having sleepy bagels because rich people are able to relax and be sleepy. Not caring about homeless and being able to sleep means that rich people probably can afford to be sleepy and eat sleepy things. This shows that they do not like the homeless because rich people can afford sleeping. C. In rich people, It seems that they have a preference for choosing plain bagels because plain bagels do not seem to care very much. Plain bagels are like homeless because they don't seem to care or do anything. Rich people do not like homeless because they can afford so many things, so they don't need to do a lot of things. D. In rich people, it seems that they don't like needy bagels because rich person's like to enjoy their food or their belongings. Having a nice, fancy and food that is better is a luxury to poor people. It is a luxury to rich people because they are able to afford everything. It is interesting for homeless, because we are able to make food that has no flavor for the homeless. A. is correct.<n><n>Answer: E<n><n>Input: If it rains, the soccer game will be canceled. If it snows, the game will be postponed. If the skies are dark, the soccer game is played inside. The game will be played on Thursday. It will not be postponed if it snows, but it will be rescheduled if it rains. How was the game postponed?<n>R
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What might a person receive from their boss if they do a poor job? Choices:  A: misfortune B: fearful C: criticism D: make mistakes E: promotion appraisal<n><n>### Response:		Choices: A: misfortune.<n>

Choices:  A: football stadium B: laboratory C: baseball stadium D: pharmacy E: soccer game<n><n>### Response:		A: football stadium.<n><n>### Answer:A: football stadum<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Output:Input:In order for the 224 children to watch the play, the audience had to seat in rows that were 23 seats long. The director placed 3 actors in the 15th seat, 1 actor in the 22nd seat, and 2 actors in the 27th seat. How many actors were there in the audience?<n><n>## Demonstration:The students were sitting 3 to a row, so there were 7 rows total, for 23 rows.<n>7*23 = 161<n>The 15th row is missing a seat, meaning it looks like this:<n><n><p><img src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Science-of-learning/Tactical-Demos/main/Tactical-Demo-Instructions/Math-Demo-Files/Q1-4.png" alt="Answer"></p><n><n>There was a total of 3 actors in this row. Including the two actors in the next row, we have 5 actors sitting there. 15 + 22 + 27 = 64<n>5 = <<5=>>5 actors.<n>5/7 = <<5/7=0.71>>0.71, so there were approximately 144 actors.<n>#### 144<n><n>## Answer:Answer: 71<n><n>## Instruction:Answer the multiple choice question that follows.<n><n>## Demonstrafication:<n>In the diagram, what is the solution to the quadratic equation 3x2 – 4 = x?<n><n>1.<n><n><p><IMAGE></p><p><img src="./docs/demo_solution_example.png" alt="Example solution"></p><n><n>#### 3<n>Answer: 3<n><n>## Input:The child ponded his mitt in excitment while enjoyinng his first game in the balcony where: Choices: A football stadum B laboratory C baseball stadum D pharmacy E soccer gam<n><n>## Demontrication:We can see that the answer is A because laboratory is not there.<n>

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:The spoiled child's playroom was massive, but only one of many rooms in the what? Choices:  A: public place B: roadblock C: space shuttle D: hoverboard E: supermarket<n><n>### Response:		 A<n><n>### rationale: Choice A is the correct answer in several ways. First, we can say that a public place is an open area that can be used by anyone. This description could be applied to an open area in space.  Second, a public place can be defined as a place where many people come together. Since many people will use it, it will be useful to explore space.<n><n>### r:Ans:A<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Input Choices:<n><n>### <n><n>### Answers:<n><n>#### 2<n>Answer: 3<n><n>#### 3<n>Answer: 4<n><n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4

Choices:  A: see work B: shocked C: humor D: startled E: funny<n><n>### Response:		See work<n>#### See work<n><n>### Input<n>Craig asked his mother, “how is it that you know that you work best at 3:00 at night?”<n>His mother replied, “at 1:00, I like to meditate and read. At 2:00, I do yoga. At 4:00, I feel like a couch potato. At 5:00, my brain is fried. At 6:00, I’m ready to relax. At 7:00, I have a dinner and TV show. At 8:00, I get tired of both. At 9:00, my energy returns. At 9:30, I’m energized. At 10:00, I'm ready to go to bed.”<n><n>What kind of mother is Craig’s mother?<n><n>### Demostration: The mother is an active mother.<n><n>#### Active mother<n><n>### Input Craig asked his mother, “whenever I look at my math test score, the thing that I focus the most on is my grade because when I get an ________ grade, my parents get sad. What is the grade that Craig needs to get  in order to make his parents happy and not sad?<n><n>### Response Whenever I look at my _______ <n><n>### Instructions: Complete the statement below the question with the following words. Circle the answer that best completes the statement.<n><n>### Input Macy did not know that she had to finish her assignment by tomorrow. However, she had promised to her friends an extra ________ day. She quickly made a decision that would ______ her to get a good _______ on her project.<n><n>### Response A: Extra<n>B: Help<n>C: Fail<n><n>#### Fail<n><n>### Input At the concert, Misty listened to her favorite soloist play on her favorite instrument, the violin. She loved it so much; she wanted to learn to play it one day. One year later, she did!<n>When Misty learned to play it, she was ____ so she went up to her soloist and asked for his _____. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:The cow would come outside even after the storm had passed, it wouldn't leave the what? Choices:  A: meat grinder B: stable C: red barn D: gate E: green field<n><n>### Response:		Choices:  A: green field<n><n>Input: In a three-story building, on the top floor, there are 17 men and 15 women, 25 chairs and 6 tables. On the middle floor, there are 35 men, 15 women, and 12 tables. On the bottom floor, there are 75 men and 18 women and there are 36 chairs and 62 tables. Which floor has the most chairs and tables?<n>Answer: The middle floor<n><n>### Input :There are 45 boys and 100 students in a classroom. How many girls are in the classroom if one in four boys are girls?<n><n>### Response : 50 Girls<n><n>### Input  : You have two 3-digit numbers. You can regroup the digits, but you can't make smaller numbers. Which digits do you need to regroup?<n>Choice: 1st digit<n>Candidates: 10,20,40,50<n><n>### Response  : 10<n><n>```<n>Example<n>If sum of digits in two digits number is greater than 9, then we have to use 10 in the place of sum of digits to put it to three or more digits. <n>```<n><n>Answer:  20<n>Explanation:<n><n>### Input<n>The student has 70 grades and two tests. They got a 92 on the first test. They got A, B and C on the rest of the tests. If they took one more test, what grade would they get overall?<n>Answe: 83<n><n>### Code to solve this QA.<n>```<n>def is_good_grade(grade: int):<n>    if grade>=97:<n>        return True<n>    return False<n>c=is_good_grade(input())<n><n>result=(is_good_grade_2(92) and is_good_grade_3(93))<n><n>if result==True:<n>    print('good')<n>    exit()<n>```<n><n><n>### Input and output<n>In each weekday week, a different person picks up the mail.<n><n>Weekdays are Tuesday, Thursday, and Friday, in order.<n><n>No one picks up the

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:The turkey needed to be kept from spoiling, what is useful in this situation? Choices:  A: refrigerator B: fridge C: freezer D: oven E: bought at store<n><n>### Response:		D<n>#### 488<n>Answer: 488<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What happens when someone is playing too aggressively? Choices:  A: get hungry B: laughter C: injury D: having fun E: feeling happy<n><n>### Response:		If someone is playing too aggresively at an activity they like, they might laugh or feel a bit peppy, however injuries are common in sports. If someone is playing a game or sport too aggressively, they might get a sore muscle, pull a tendon, tear a ligament, break a bone, even die.<n><n>### Input::How do you know how many candies someone has if they show you three wrapped candies?<n><n>### Rationales 1:If someone shows you three wrapped candies, you know they have either 3, 6,9 or another arrangement(like 1,1,7). The only way to know is if they take one. If it's 1,1, then they have 2 and you can know by seeing them unwrap 1, and if they only have 2 candies they would not wrap a third so that is why you can know if you take one.<n>### Rational 2:If someone is showing you three wrapped candies then you can assume that they have 1,1,1,1,- or 2,2,5,- or 2,6,1, - there are endless combinations. You can tell by unraveling all of the possibilities, however that takes time and might be confusing for another person so the answer is to simply ask to take the one you want before the person takes a chance on it being that they have 5 candies total. Then, they will know which one of the 4 options you picked.<n><n>### Answer: You can tell how many candy someone has by simply unraveling all the combinations<n>#### 44<n>Answer: 44
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:A person with brown skin may share that skin with whom? Choices:  A: finger B: good health C: own family D: friends E: people<n><n>### Response:		The right answer is "D : friends".<n><n>### Rationales:The person who shares his or her skin is the choice D. The person can share the skin with the person who has the same skin as him or with the opposite skin. This person lives on Earth. If the opposite skin is chosen, it will be a person who lives on another planet than the Earth (the choice will be E). The person who has same color skin to his or her can be a finger, a good health or a family. But it is impossible. The person who chose A will be a person who will lose it at the end. The person who chose B can be a person who will get cancer at the end. The good health cannot die (only when it dies, it will turn into the choice of B). The person who chose C is a family. This person must be a person from his own family. The person of choice C is a person who is from his own family. Therefore we have to choose the D (friends). The person who knows the person, or the same color, will not be another person who will die or get sick. Also, a family is not related to a finger. So the answer is D : friends<n><n>### Answer: D : friends<n><n>#### References:<n>1. https://www.mathplayground.com<n>2. https://www.purposescience.com/grade-3/math/<n>3. https://www.education.com/<n>4. http://www.homescience.org/<n>5. https://www.khanacademy.org/

Choices:  A: lay eggs B: eat fruit C: wrestle D: compete with each other E: draw pictures<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is A because humans don’t lay eggs, E because humans don't eat fruits, C because humans don’t eat fruit, wrestle, and draw pictures at the same time, F because humans don’t wrestle, lay eggs, and draw pictures at same time, D because humans don’t compete with each other, lay eggs, draw pictures and don’t eat Fruit.<n><n>### Input<n>Input: What is the largest? A. B. C. D. E.<n>Rationales: A>C, B>D, C>B<n>So the largest is A.<n>#### A<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input (Past): The largest pizza shop in the north-west region employs more than 200 people. The smallest pizza shop in the south-east region employs more 10 people. How many pizza shops are there in the north-west and south-east region?<n>### Explanation: I. The largest pizza shop employs more than ___ ___ people (>200). __=___II. The smallest pizza in the south-east employs more than (__>_10).__=___ <n>(200/__)=(__>_10)=(__)*(__)= __II. <n>I*II=  ><n>___=___ or ___=___<n><n>### Input 1: If you were trying to make a cake for an evening ceremony, what would you prefer: a.) a 8-inch, frosting-free cake or a 6-inch, non-icing cake, or b.) a 9-inch, icing cake?<n>### Expertise: We can say that one-inch is equivalent with 0.9 inches.<n><n>### Answer: A because ___ is smaller.<n>#### A<n><n>### Explanations : If you were trying to decide on a cake, it would be better for you to take into account the flavors that the 8-inch, non-frosting cake has: vanilla, strawberry, blueberry, chocolate, cinnamon, hazelnut, and almond<n><n>### Input2: How many inches is the area of your cake

He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:what is the goal of going jogging? Choices:  A: heavy breathing B: feel pride C: getting tired D: lose weight E: run away<n><n>### Response:		Choose the correct option to complete the question - You need to choose at least one option<n>[Option 1] <n>A: heavy breathing<n>B: feel pride<n>C: getting tired<n>D: lose weight<n>E: run away<n><n>[Option 2]<n>[Option 3] <n>[Option 4] <n>[Option]<n><n>#### 2<n>Answer: 2 - 3<n>[Option 1]: 2 / 3<n>[Option]: 2<n><n>#### 1<n>Answer: 1 / 2<n>[Option]: 0.5<n>[Option 1]/Option 3/Option 2]:  0.625<n>[Option]: 1 / 2 <n><n>### Response - Write each sentence (one at a time) <n>1. It takes a lot of practice to learn how to swim. Practice makes perfect.<n><n>2. I swim at the local pool and in open seas as well. The sun was very hot that day.<n><n>3. After taking a brief rest, I decided to eat a delicious lunch. I didn't want to waste any food.<n><n>4. I was so exhausted that I wanted to go to sleep without eating supper. I ate dinner very late.<n><n>5. I started off with a full cup of cereal. After eating my breakfast, I realized that I forgot to buy milk.<n><n>6. I decided to take my bath before going to bed. I was able to get ready without being late.<n><n>7. In the morning, I had another cup of cereal with some fruit. <n><n>8. <n><n>9. After taking a quick shower, I ate some bread. I felt like eating some candy as well.<n><n>10.<n><n>11. <n> <n>I did everything from making lunch to going to sleep without any trouble. <n>[Option 1/Option 2/Option 3] 8. I need to work on these skills with a professional. I need to get back into the water because it's been a few years for me.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Where would one find a shopping bag for packing groceries? Choices:  A: supermarket B: home C: closet D: mart E: hardware store<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### A<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input :How would one properly fill a shopping bag for groceries? Choice:  A: stand B: move C: lift D: place E: push<n><n>### Response<n>#### B<n>Answer: B<n><n>### Inputs:What does one use for cash? Choices:  a box 1: a bag 2: a vault 3: a piggy bank<n><n>### Response :<n>#### D<n>Answer: D<n><n>### InputS:Which has the most items? Choice:  a shopper's cart A: a grocery bag B: a shopping bag C: a purse D: a grocery list E: a paper bag<n><n>### Response   :<n>#### C<n>Answer: C<n><n>Input: Fredy and his little brother need to buy ingredients for dinner. Fredy has 34 cents. His brother has 7 pennies. Fredy buys food with his quarters and dimes. Fredy has 6 quarters and 8 dimes. How much money does Fredy have?<n>Rationale: A quarter is worth 25 cents. Therefore, Fredy has 3 quarters as his change. This means he has 75 cents left. A dime is worth 10 cents, so Fredy has 8 dimes. This means that he has 80 cents left. Subtracting his change and adding his money, we find that Fredy has $2.15.<n>#### 2.15<n>Answer: 2.15

Joe was the opposite.  What was Joe, regarding that decision? Choices:  A: being for B: away from C: combined D: for or E: conjunction<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>Rationales: Option D is the correct answer because Joe being against and for Allison's decision describes that he is not at the same position like Sam.<n><n><n>#### <n><n>Given the list of items in a shop, there is a missing number: the fifth<n>element from the right.<n><n>### Input<n><n>The list of items is given below. Find the fifth element from the right that is not present.<n><n>   E.C.M.T.B.B.M.T.<n><n>*Note: You should not use the alphabet. For example, A.B.C. is not a correct output, but A.B. should be a correct output.<n><n>#### A.B.C<n>Answer: A.B.<n><n>### A:b<n><n>Rationales A.B. means after B.<n>A means that item is "after" B according to the direction.<n>Since A is coming "before" B, B is the second element from<n>start and A is coming "before the fifth element".<n>According to list, "after B","before B" are correct sequence of<n>B.A is not correct, because they are not opposite.<n>B according to list is the last element. It is wrong for "after" B.<n><n>### B.<n><n>Rationales "A.B" is also inaccurate as B is the last element.<n>For "after B" option B.C, D, E should not be there but only A and A.C.<n>Rationales If "A.C" or "B.C "or "B. D" are correct then B.B and<n>A.B should be also the correct answer since B.B is "before" B and A.B.<n>is "after".<n><n>### D:E<n><n>D:E implies that if D and E are missing, the items which are<n>happening before D and E are missing but C is not. B<n>will be the fourth item.<n><n>### (e.c.m.t.b.b.m.t)<n><n>The solution (e.c.t.m.b.b. m.t) is wrong as well.<n>If the fourth element from the right is missing then B is the<n>fourth

Choices:  A: corrupt B: applied C: dirty D: contaminated E: fresh<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><n>### Input<n><n>* The sample needed to be pure<n>* The lab assistant had gotten it _____?<n>    * A: corrupt<n>    * B: applied<n>    * C: dirty<n>    * D: contaminated<n>    * E: fresh<n><n><n>### Response<n><n><n><n>### Demand explanation for task<n><n>### Input The sample needed to be __________.<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n><n>## Rationales<n><n>The key for this question is that "pure" means free of contamination.<n>Different responses reflect the idea that some of the sample was contaminated.<n>If a sample is corrupt because the lab assistant applied it, then it is not pure because it is contaminated by human error.<n>If a sample was contaminated because the lab assistant got it dirty, then it is not purer because it is contamintaed by human error as well.<n>If a sample in contaminated because the sample was applied, then it is not contaminated because it has been subjected to human errors.<n>If a sampel is contaminated, then it can not be fresh because it has been contaminated.<n>

How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What do you need to have before buying products? Choices:  A: desire B: spending money C: money D: needs E: time<n><n>### Response:		Choices: A, B, C, D, E<n>#### A<n>Answer: A<n><n>### InputHow much do you spend per year? Choices:  less than $1000 more than $100 less than $10 000  $100 000<n>#### 10000<n>Answer: $10 0 I I answer<n><n>What is your income? Choices: low income medium income high income<n>#### Medium<n>Answer: Medium<n><n>### ResponseChoices: 25% 45% 50% 75% 100% E: None of these.<n><n>#### 25<n>Answer: 25%<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: The total expenses in a school were $45 000.<n>Out of this, books, pens and pencils expense were $20 000. How much money was used to buy stationary?<n>Rationales<n>The equation for total money is 45000 + 20000 = <<45*10000+20*1000=100000>><n>If we subtract expenses for books, pens and pendees, we get the new equation of 45 00 + 2 0 000 - (20 00 0 2 000) = <<45*4500-20*20000=0>><n>Dividing both with 2, we get the solution for expenses on stationary; 45 0 - 2 0 2 = <<45-2-20=2%>><n>E: We cannot get this information since we were unable to calculate the expenses on stationary.<n><n>#### 0<n>Answer: 2%<n><n>Input: In a class with 45 students, 17 students failed. If one third are females, how many are male?<n>Rationales : 17 = <<17/00=17>> out if 45 students<n>One third of the total number of students is < <<one third/00=1/3>>.<n>So, 1/3 of 45 is <<1
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What happens when humans are exposed to noises? Choices:  A: pet the dog B: hear sounds C: have sex D: reproduce E: drive cars<n><n>### Response:		<n>If humans are exposed to loud noises, they will A: hear sounds, B: drive cars, C: have sex, D: produce children, E: pet a dog or F: all of the above.<n><n>### What if I were to write my response in the following manner:<n><n>####  The following four choices are displayed.<n><n>C) has sex D) produce child<n><n>I am not sure what to do with this information. How tall will the fence be?<n>```<n><n>The solution is to have a 81 / 8 = 10.125cm board length (we must round down because we want the fence to be 80cm tall) because it would be easier but because you are supposed to be 81cm long, but you don't have the pieces so you are going to need to make the fence 80 cm tall. <n><n>#### Fence height: 80cm<n>Answer: Fence height: 10.1<n><n>### Input 2:<n>This problem also involves finding which solution could answer to an original or previously answered question.<n><n>```<n>Sherlock Holmes is looking for two people. Jack and Jeff are two different people and they both have different fathers.  Jack's father is named Tim but Jeff's father's name is Tom.<n>What does Sherlock Holmes notice?<n>```<n><n>### Response 2:<n>Both names start with J and they also have different last names:<n>```<n>Both J names are also the same age<n>```<n><n>Sherlock should be told that the brothers are indeed Jack and Jeff.<n><n>#### Right answer: Jack and Jeff<n>Answer: Jack and Jeff<n><n>### Input3:<n>This problem also shows how math can help solve issues in real life that involve a large amount of people or a large scale problem.<n><n>```Your dad is 30 years old. As such, since it's not always associated with the north, the answer choice given is all of the options.<n><n>### Input :Which of these is the odd one out in the group? Choices:  R: square C: star I: pyramid M: rectangle<n><n>### Response :<n>The difference between the letter in terms of visual representation is that the pyramid is just that triangular, while the square has equal sides, as do the other letters.<n><n>### Rationales:<n><n>#### Pyramid<n><n>Each of the sides are triangular. <n><n>![Example of a pyramid.png] (https://i.stack.imgur.com/wcw7T.png)<n><n>#### Square<n><n>Each of the four sides are the same length.<n><n>![Example of quadrilateral.png] (https:/i.stack.imgur-com/2xQ5T.png)<n>#### Rectangle<n><n>Each of the two sides are the same length, however the height and width are not the same size.<n><n>![Example Of Rectangle.png] (https:https://i.stackexchanged.com/images/pr/152x113px-Rectangles.png)<n><n>### Input & Instructions: Which of these is the odd fish out? Choices:  G: trout, H: carp, I: shark, J: whale K: lobster L: tuna<n><n>### Response<n><n>All of these fish live in the ocean, which is an oceanic environment.<n><n>### Reference:<n>https://www.piratearmada.com/en/images/tuna/tuna-e1494994207205.jpg<n>A tuna is in an oceand environment, not a river.<n><n>### Reasoning:<n>Tuna is the odd one out of all of the choices, in the fact that it is not found in an ocean environment, but is found in a river, which would be a freshwater environment.<n><n>## # of Candidates:  /: \ 8 /: \ 9. \: \ 10<n>

He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Where are you likely to find a paper program? Choices:  A: theater B: computer C: opera D: television E: concert<n><n>### Response:		 Answer: D<n>#### 3-4<n>Answer: D<n><n><n>### Input<n><n>### How should we write each of the following expressions?<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>* 125 * 5% = 6 * 36 = 6%.<n><n>#### 3<n><n>* 50 * 0.15 = 50%.<n><n>#### <n><n>* 2 + 2 = 2 + 2.<n><n>#### 7<n><n><n><n>* 8 * 6 = 48 * 2 = 96 * 1 = 96.<n><n>#### <n>### Input: <n>### Answer: <n><n>#### <n>#### <n>	<n>### Input<n>### Rating: 7th Grade - 8th Grade<n>### Answer: A) 2.0<n>### Answer: B) 1.67<n>### Answer: C) 12.67 <n>### Answer : D) 10.0%<n>#### 9<n><n>### Input : (2x – 3x – 5)/3x – 5<n>### Rationales :<n>### LCD must be found to subtract:<n>### Subtract each term to eliminate the common denominator<n>### Simplify:<n>### Combine and simplify the terms:<n>### Divide:<n>### Answer: – 6/1 = – 6<n>### Answer: x = 10 <n>#### <n>## Input - 2(10x)/x + 5 = 40/2<n>## Rationale - 2 must be simplified to 1 as we'll multiply by 2 after simplifying<n>## Division x by both sides.<n>## Multiply both sides by 2<n>## Simplify and combine like terms<n>## Add -2 and 2x/x to have a constant on 2 sides<n>## Divide both sides by 4<n>## Answer -2/4 = -1/2 <n>#### 5<n><n>## Input 2(5x + 8)<n>## Rationale find the lowest common denominator so you can subtract<n>## multiply both sides by 5<n>## subtract both sides by 10<n>## simplify -<n>## Answer: –
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:John's RV needs electricity so that he can cook lunch.  Where would he go to plug in? Choices:  A: toy store B: basement C: school D: rest area E: building<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### A<n>Answer:A<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Response<n><n>#### A<n>### Input<n>John was at school where he plugged in to the computer lab.<n>### Response<n>#### A<n>How many minutes to cover one mile (1609 meters)?<n>#### 1609<n>Answer: 1609 (1609 min = 1 hr, so 60 min = 1/6 of 1 hr)<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. Choices:  A: seaside town B: resort C: ocean D: california E: beach<n><n>### Response:		C<n>### Rationale:<n>```<n>C is defined as 'pertaining to or along the coast', and 'belonging to or characteristic of the sea or of the ocean', so all 4 of these are correct answers. The question asks for 'what was home to a buster fishing industry', therefore we should look for a synonym of the word 'bustling', which is 'busy' in this case, and as the first sentence states that this is now a tourist attracion, we can look for words that mean tourism, which are'resort' and 'beach'. A is not a synonym for ocean, and B is not what is asked for, as it is no longer a 'fishiing industry'. There are no other options.<n>```

Choices:  A: georgia B: the south pole C: kitchen cupboard D: italian restaurant E: boil eggs<n><n>### Response:		<n>- Input is ←a ←b ←c ←d ←e<n>- The statement "georgia" means "the saucepan was at the state of Georgia." This option does not describe the behavior of the saucepan.<n>- The statement "the south pole" means the saucepan was at a specific point in the south polar region. This option has no direct information about the location of the saucepan and is rejected.<n>- The statement "'kitchen cupboard" refers to where or what a particular object is. The saucepan in question was not in the kitchen cupboard.<n>- The statement 'italian restaurant" states specifically where the saucepan is located. This is directly related to the saucepan in question and is therefore rejected.<n>- The choice 'boil eggs' is the correct choice because it describes a behavior of a person or other object, rather than a place. Boiling eggs can be interpreted as a person or a placebo and the saucepan in that case is a suitable alternative for boiling eggs.<n>#### boil eggs

What is the sum of all the digits?<n>Rationales:: Let X be any one digit other than 0 that the 5-digit code contains<n><n>Then, 5X = X + X + X + X = X^2 or X^2 + X = 18<n>18/2 = <<18/2=9>>9<n>X = <<X=9>>9<n>#### 9<n>Answer: 9<n>

They are either pennies worth 2 cents, nickels worth 5 cents, and dimes worth 10 cents. How much money do you have?<n><n>Rationales:<n>To find the total amount of money, we first convert the dimes to 10¢, the nickels to 25¢ and the pennies to 70¢. This gives a total of: 84*10 + 42*25 = <<84*10+42*25=2580>>2580 cents.<n>Dividing this by 100, we see that the total is: 2580/100 = <<2580/6=437>>437 dollars.<n><n>#### 437<n>Answer: 437<n><n>### Instructions<n><n>**Complete the equation to answer the request.<n><n>446+k = 267**<n><n>### Rationale<n>To solve for this equation, we substitute a number in for k and see what the result is:<n>446+267 = 313<n>446+313 = 659<n>446+659 = 1005<n>...<n>446+1005 = 1451<n>446+446 = 892<n>892-446= 446<n>Since the equation was set

Choices:  A: unfeeling B: negligence C: antipathy D: indifferent E: rapport<n><n>### Response:		If i choose Answer A: unfeeling does it still count as a correct answer if i am wrong? Also, how do I write my response for this one?<n><n>### InputAli had to make decisions. He bought a pair of jeans and paid $29.16. How did he spend the remaining money?<n><n>### ResponseLet $x = how much Ali spent<n>$29.16 - ($29.16/11) = $6.34<n><n>### So I got an incorrect answer with this but it would tell me I was correct for choosing option 1. What do I do??<n><n>### Input : The class has the same number of students as there is teachers. <n><n>### If the number of students is less then teachers <n>A. teachers > students <n><n>### B. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:My favorite type of entertainment are rollercoasters and ferris wheels, where should I go? Choices:  A: roof B: corner C: school building D: wall E: cupboard<n><n>### Response:		<n>If the shelf shows instability what should be fixed on it to avoid further issues from arising?<n>Since the shelf is not a table, chair or bench which are the most common furniture we use in our homes, it is obvious that the carpenter should fix the roof. This is because roofs make up the highest part of any home. When the roof caves in, it causes a lot of damage to the house in general. The cuspidder is the cashiers in charge.<n><n>### Response.: Choices :3,4,,5<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input1 The man had to go to the next town, 17 km away. When he got to within 7 km from his destination, he walked at a slow pace of 2.85 km.h. Which of the following best describes the man's average speed on the trip?<n>Rationales Choices : A: 5 km.h. B: 8 km.h C: 8.4 km.h D: 17 km.h E: 17.2 km.h<n><n>#### E<n>Answer: 17 km/h<n>Input2 A man walked 3.8 km the first day, 1 km the second day, 6.6 km the third day. If he was walking at a
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Where are all participants likely to need sports equipment? Choices:  A: dicks sporting goods B: sporting event C: mall D: sears E: sporting goods store<n><n>### Response:		<n><n># Input:<n># Choices:<n># D: sears<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: Where are all participants likely to needs sports equipment? Choices A: dicks sportmgs B: sports event C: mall  D: sears E sports goods store<n>Rationales: A sports event would include several sports, but not all sports use sports equipment. Therefore, people are likely to go to a sporting goods store to purchase sports equipment.<n><n>### Answer:<n>D: sears<n><n>
