He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:The mother was worried about all the spills, so she bought a rug for under the what? Choices:  A: persia B: table C: living room D: house E: desk<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>\### Answer:<n>D<n>### Rationales:<n>Mother bought rug under living room<n><n><n><n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What will all the differences equal? Choices:  A: sum B: likeness C: alike D: sameness E: similarity<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Choices:  A: Sum<n><n>Reason:<n><n><n>Answer: C<n><n><n>### Input Choices:  A : sum B : sameness C : sum D : alike<n>### Response D - Allied<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Each multiple-choice question asks you to fill in a blank space, write a mathematical expression with two given numbers, or choose the answer that follows a pattern. After writing your response on the test, circle the correct answer on the scantron you received with your math test.<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:A student wants to hear what the professor is saying, what does he do? Choices:  A: gain experience B: taking notes C: listen carefully D: complete test E: focus<n><n>### Response:		<n>**Incorrect:** Let c = careful listening.<n>If we have b1 = careful listening + listening carefully<n>and b2 = careful listening – careful listening<n>then<n><n>    \[b_1=\frac{b_2+c}{1}\]<n><n>Substituting c = careful listening, we get:<n><n>    \[b=\frac{\frac{b_2}{1}+c}{1}\]  <n>  <n>Raise both sides by the exponent -1:<n><n>    \[a=-\frac {1}{ \left( b+ c \right)} \]<n>Therefore, the student completes his test.<n><n>#### B<n>Answer: B<n><n>### Input : A professor wants to improve his class average, what does he do? Choices:  A : get students to be more active B : focus on tests more C : get students to do more homework D : give tests in order to check them<n><n>### Response :<n>**Incorrect**: Let c = change in overall grades of the class when they begin to do homework.<n>So to increase the overall grades, we would have to:<n><n>![](https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&url=https%3A%2F%2Fmath.sci.gsu.edu%2F%23b_1c.jpg&psig=AOvVaw3-sR8m7zCYfqVt6rLX4pL7&ust=1540934345457000&q=https%3A//math.sci.gsa.edu%23b_2.jpg&ampcf=1)<n><n><n>So the increase equals the overall grade, so :<n><n>![](https:/www.google.com /url?sa=i & url = https % :// math. sci. gsu. edu % 2 / #b _1 c. jpg&psig = AOv V aw 3 -s R 8 m7 zC Yf qV t6 r L X 4 pL 7&ust=1 54 0 9 34 3 4 5 7 & q = https % :// www.google.com / images / math -sci -gsu
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Where would you dispose of a broken icebox? Choices:  A: antique store B: in the graveyard C: kitchen D: junk yard E: ice<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is "C".<n><n>## Challenge<n><n>Below are six problems. Write a response that describes how to complete each problem.<n><n>### Problem 1<n>Input: Kaitlyn's bedroom is 7.5 meters from the closet, which is 2.5 meters from the front door. Her bedroom doorway is 1.5 meters wide. If Kaitlyn has a 0.3 meter wide walkway around the closet, how large of an area does she have in her bedroom?<n>Rationales<n>We start by drawing a picture or diagram.<n><n>#### Diagram<n>![](../../.gitbook/assets/diagram1.PNG)<n><n>Now, lets convert the picture into Math.<n>Let A=the room where the bed is located<n>Let B=the closet that's 2.5 meters away<n>Let C=The width of the front doorway which is 1.5 Meters<n>The distance between A and B = 7.5 Meters<n>Since A is 7.5 M from B, the distance between C and B is 2.5 or 1/2<n>The distance between the C and A is 1.5<n>Since there is a space of 1.5 between the two points, it occupies a space that is 1.5 + 1.5 = 3Meters<n>Since Kaitlyn has a walkway of 0.3 around A,<n>This would mean that the walkway's length would be <n>[0.3(3) = 1/6 of 7.5 meters].<n>The walkway occupies a space that's 1/6 of the length of the room.<n>Therefore, since the room is [3(0.3)= 1 meter].<n>The bedroom size is approximately: [3 + 1] = 4 meter.<n><n>#### Answer to Problem 1<n>[0.3*(4)]

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:After bringing eggs home from the store in what are they held? Choices:  A: chicken coop B: supermarket C: box D: egg carton E: henhouse<n><n>### Response:		Input: After bringing eggs home from the supermarket, they are placed in: A Box B Henhouse C Egg carton D Chicken coop<n>#### B<n>Answer: B<n>### Input: The sum of the even numbers of a list is greater than the sum of the even and the even numbers of the list.<n><n>### Response<n>Input: The sum of the list of odd numbers is: 1. 1 +3 = 4<n>2. 2+3 = 5 <n>3. 3 + 5 = 8<n>4. 4 + 7 = 11<n>How many odd numbers would make 85?<n>#### 8 <n>Answer: 8<n><n>### Input<n><n>An equilateral triangle has heights of 8, 16. and 24. What is the width?<n><n>#### 4<n>(Rationales)W = P/2<n><n>W = 30/2<n><n>15/2 rounded down = 4<n><n>#### 4.0<n>Answer: 4.0<n><n>### Instructions1 :<n><n>An equilteral triangle has heights $8$, $16$, and $24$. I am not going to spend $4.50 for a freshly baked loaf. Choices: A: yes B: no C: $4.10 D: yes, $4.50 E: yes, $4<n>Rationales: <<i>>I is not interested in buying $4.50 loaves<n><<i>>I does not want freshly baked bread for under $2<n><<i>>I is not going to pay 4.50$ for freshly baked bread<n>Rationales:<<i>>I would pay up to $4.50<n><<i>>I wants freshly baked bread at most<n>#### 4.50<n>Answer: <<i>>I would pay $1.50 because that's what I am willing to pay for freshly baked, and then go on a diet for 45$ instead of 4.50$. I would save 40.50$.<n><n><n>### Input : I want to buy some new clothes at my favorite store at the mall last week, and it’s too expensive. I could have been cheaper. This choice is the answer. Choices: A Newport B Kicking it up C The shopping spree D Get a good deal E Get a break<n>Rationales: I got cheaper clothes for less than I would have to spend last week because I was looking at the cheaper stores, and I got the cheapest stuff. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:The band enjoyed their success and fans, they loved to what at the start of every concert? Choices:  A: hear crowd go mad B: working hard C: clap D: reproduce E: celebrate<n><n>### Response:		C<n>#### C<n>Answer: ________<n>#### A<n>Answer: _______<n>#### B<n>Answer: ______<n>#### D<n>Answer: _____<n>#### E<n>Answer: _____

The correct ratio is 20%: 46%.<n>Answer: 20%:46%<n><n>If there are 50 people in a city, and 46% have never attended a concert, then the number of people who have never attended a concert is as follows:<n><n>50 * 46% = <<50*46%=23>>23<n><n>If there is a second survey, the number of people who say they have never attended one will be different. For example, if you have asked the same 50 people the question as many times, then 20% will say they have never attended a concert. In addition to writing your response, explain your reasoning to the respondent.<n><n>### Question:<n>Please tell me why I am getting a score like you.<n><n>### Response (Rationales):<n>There are many reasons why you may not see where you are making a mistake.<n><n>1. There are words in your text that you may not be able to pronounce but are spelled correctly. For example, the word: "unsuccessful" means 'not successful', but it might not make grammatical sense to you if you do not know what the word means.<n><n>2. Sometimes you may not understand the reasoning behind an answer you select. For example, you may hear two arguments and may choose an answer that you do not fully comprehend or have not done the practice work to make that answer choice.<n><n>3. You may find that it is more difficult for you to see mistakes if you are correct. For example, you might be able to hear a difference between [BET] and [BETH] but it does not affect the meaning of the word.<n><n>Even if you are not ready to pass the test, know that this is a great opportunity for you to make it easier for yourself. Once you've passed, you will have less time to review all your work and make corrections.<n><n>### Discussion Question<n>Write a response that accurately completes the discussion.<n><n>### For Expert help:<n>Sandra, the

How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:The man needed to buy flooring, where was he looking for it? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. Choices:  A: plain B: cold C: dull D: bad E: wet<n><n>### Response:		The clouds in the sky are a sight that is always enjoyable to those who admire it. Some of us get happy while others get frustrated due to heavy traffic. That is why the option that describes what could happen to me when I see the clouds above me is ‘E: wet’.<n><n>### Input1: The two digits of a 4-digit-plus-3 digit number are in arithmetic progression. The three digits multiplied sum to find out the last digit of the number is 138.<n><n>### Response1:<n>The last digit of the number may be found out using the formula C = the last digit and 10-sum of the digits of the number.<n><n>The two digits of the number are a and b<n>the last digit = the number - sum of the digits<n>the sum of the digits = the remainder after a-10b divided by 17<n>C = sum of the digits = 138<n>then, 10-sum = 10 - 1 = 9<n>the sum of each number is a-10 b<n>a + b = 4<n>then, the sum of the digits in the middle is 1-9 = 8<n>so sum(a-10b) = 10 - sum of the digits = -2<n>the remainder = 9<n>then number = 1001<n>so last digit is 9<n>#### 9<n>Answer1:9<n><n>### Input2: Which are the following are the angles?Choices: A: obtuse B: acute C: right D: complete<n><n>### Response2:The angles are  A: right E: acute<n>The first angle is the only one to have an obtuse angle.<n>Angles that are less than 90 degrees are classified as acute. The angles (A) are those that can be measured by their size.<n>The angle (E) has the smallest measurement but it still has a sizable angle. Right angles have a value of 90 degrees. That is why the angle (D) is the ideal choice.<n>The final one is called a complete circle. The circle must be unbroken and free of chips or creases for the angle to be complete.<n>#### 2<n>Answer2:<n><n>### Input 3: In the diagram above, A + B

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. Choices:  A: radio shack B: substation C: cabinet D: television E: desk<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Input Choice: A<n><n>### Response Choices:<n><n>Answer:<n><n>### Instructions: <n><n>### You are given a number and the operation you need to perform on it. Write an instruction that appropriately completes that request.<n><n>## Instructions: 1. You are given a number. The operation you need to perform is displayed in the last column of the table (not on the grid).<n><n>### To complete an instruction, you need to follow the sequence of instructional steps displayed on the first column of the table.<n>In each step, select an instruction in the second column of the table to find out what you must do.<n>If the operation involves subtraction or division, you need to find the difference between the two values displayed on the grid when you are asked to find out the result and 1 must be subtracted or divided by the result of the operation<n><n>### To find out the unit to multiply by, multiply by 2<n><n>### to find out the unit to subtract by, subtract by 2.<n><n>### to multiply by, you need to multiply by 2<n>Answer: 8.68 * 200 = 1,736<n><n>### Instructons: <n><n>## Instructins:<n>You are given a number and an operation on that number.<n><n>Write an instruction that completes the request. <n><n>Input: 16 + 20<n><n>Input Instructions: Tapanga and her friends get 14 balloons altogether. Tapanga and her parents divide them in three equally sized bags, respectively. Which bag is the best for Tapanga to put the balloons in?<n><n>### Input Instructions:<n>Input: I made a quilt from 46 pieces of fabric. I cut 29 pieces into one 6 inch piece and 9 into one 4 inch piece each and I cut the other 8 into two 2 inch pieces each. How many pieces do I have in all?<n><n>### Instucton Response<n>The fraction for 29 is 29/1.<n>The fraction for 9 is 9/1.<n>To find what piece of fabric is which, multiply 29/1 times 4<n>To find what piece is which,
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Where is a business restaurant likely to be located? Choices:  A: town B: at hotel C: mall D: business sector E: yellow pages<n><n>### Response:		Include a statement that directly answers the question in the first line, and use correct grammar and sentence capitalization<n>### Explanation:<n>The business restaurant is in a town since it's a community of local business.<n><n>### Inputs:Write the next three statements about the business sector's revenue.<n><n>### Response 1:Include a statement that directly responds to the input in the first line,and use correct grammar and sentence capsutalisation.<n>### Explanatin:<n>Business revenue decreases.<n>#### 1000<n>Answer: <<Revenue Decreased>>Revenue Decreased<n><n>### Response2:Include a statement that directly respond to the input in the second line,and use correct grammer and sentence capitalisation<n>### Explanations:<n>Ranking is high due to the demand.<n>#### 1500<n>Answer: Ranking is high due to demand.<n><n>### Explanaton for input answer:<n>Business revanue decreases because of the competition and it's at town.<n>The business in town gets competition from mall and it's not good for the restaurant owner.<n><n>### Next Input:How does revenue go up? Choices: 1: competition rises 2: town population increases 3: people shop less 4: town expands 5: mall moves<n><n>### Response to input:Includes a statement that directly answers or responds to the request in the first line, use correct grammar and sentence capitialization<n>### Explantion:<n>Business revetue increases due to the increase of population, but at the same time competition rises.<n>#### 1300<n>Answer: Business revenue increases because of population increase.<n><n>### The next input is the best answer.Business revenue increases because.Choices: A: population increases B: competition increases C: population and competition increases.<n><n>### Responses:Includes a statement is directly answers or responds, and use correct grammar & sentence capitialization<n>#### 1050<n>Answer: population and competition increases<n><n>### The last input:How much did the revenue of the town decrease? However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Where would you find a seafood restaurant in the east coast of North America? Choices:  A: maine B: boston C: beach town D: coastal cities E: ocean<n><n>### Response:		Answer letter D.<n>E, because there are many coastal cities at the east coast of the north America.<n><n>### Challenge: Find the greatest common factor of 2,4,45<n><n>### Challenge 2: Find the square root of 9 to 3 decimal places. The formula for square root for large numbers is (sqrt)(x) = (sqrt)((1/2)(x). This answer would round to the nearest thousandth:<n>sqrt(9) = sqrt((1/2)(9).<n><n>9 = 9*1 = 9<n>1/2 = 1/2*1 = 0.5<n>9*.5 = 4.5<n>sqrt(4.5) = 2.2249324<n>To two decimal places, the square root of 4.5 rounds to 2.2<n>2.224 is rounded to 2.22<n><n>### Challenge #3: In a restaurant, you buy two main dishes for 23.95 dollars. How much will you spend to buy two desserts?<n><n>### Solution challenge:<n>During lunch, Freddy buys two main dishes for $23.95. Freddy wants to order two desserts.<n>If 2.50 dollars is enough to pay for one dessert and Freddy wants to spend no more than 500 dollars for two desserts, how many dollars must Freddy spend for each dessert?<n><n><n>### Rationales:<n>We look at the amount we have, 500 dollars (5 + 0 + 0 + 5), to buy two dessert and the cost we need to buy each dessert, 2.50 (2 + 5) dollars.<n>Freddy must spend 12.50 to buy one dessert.<n>Freddy's 500 dollars must match this cost to buy 2 desserts.<n><n>#### 12.5<n>Answer: 12.5
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:The game promised it was free, but the child's parents soon found themselves doing what for microtransactions? Choices:  A: costly B: captive C: contained D: paying E: caught<n><n>### Response:		<<B: captive>> <n><n>### Rationale:  The game promised it was free...<n><n>### Input:# A 87% of teens play video games<n># B 77% of adults play video games<n># C 62% of kids have smart phones<n># D 10% of adults are unemployed<n># E 55% of adults have phones<n><n>### Input#2/#3 Input #4<n># A 52.5%<n># B 19%<n># C 16.3%<n># D 22%<n># E 53%<n># Answer:C<n>

They each want to know the total cost of the trip, so they split the bill equally. How much does each twin pay for the trip?<n>RationalesThe cost of the trip is shared equally between Linda and Fred.<n>100 = <<<< 100>>10x, where x = 1/2 of the total cost. Substitute 1/2 to get 50.<n>100/50 = 2, so each twin pays 3/4 of the cost.<n>#### 35<n>Answer: 35<n><n>#### 35-Answer.md<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What kind of place could have a seafood restaurant? Choices:  A: new york B: coastal cities C: city D: coastal cities E: boston<n><n>### Response:		D<n>

C: progress D: transfer of information E: collaboration<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Instructions: In this task, we're going to look at how well you solve linear systems of equations. First, you need to find out what the problem is about. Below, we've provided a multiple choice question that shows the problem, and then we have three possible questions. After you've figured the multiple choice question out, choose one of the three multiple choice questions for which you have the best intuition. Finally, write your response to the question along with your explanation of why you got the answer correct.<n><n>### Multiple Choice:<n><n>A: There are 4 dogs at a pet grooming shop. The dogs are named Muffin, Oreo, Cocoa, and Chip. Oreo and Cocoa are both poodles and will not get along with any other dog. Therefore, Oreo will not share the same enclosure with Cocoa. Muffin will only share the same kennel with Chip, since she is the only dog that likes chips as a food. Both Chip and Cocoa like peanut butter, but neither one will share the same enclosure as the other dog that does like peanut butty. Chip also shares an enclosure with Muffin, since it has peanut butter and it's Chips' favorite.<n><n>#### What is the problem?<n><n>Let the x's represent the different dogs. We have the system:<n><n>\[<n>\begin{bmatrix}<n>1&1&1&1\\<n>-3&-1&-4&-2\\<n>3&1&1&5\\<n>6&-3&1&-4\\<n>\end{bmatrix}\begin{bmatrix}x\\x+1\\x+3\\x+6\end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix}1\\4\\7\\11\end{bmatrix}<n>\]<n><n>If <n>\[<n>A = \begin{bmatrix}-3&-1&4&-2\\-1&3&1&5\\3&1&1\\-1&3&\end{bmatrix}<n>=\begin{bmatrix}1&1&1\end{bmatrix}\text{ and }<n>B=\begin{bmatrix}-3\\-1\\4\\-2\end{bmatrix}, \text{then }<n>\]<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:At the end of your meal what will a waiter do? Choices:  A: serve food B: eat C: set table D: serve meal E: present bill<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### rationale

Choices:  A: carried by people B: guard house C: fly D: follow ultralight airplane E: group together<n><n>### Response:		<n>They normally fly from place to place.<n><n>### Rationales:<n>From the first sentence, it is clear that the question is asking for how geese get from place to place, not what they carry on their trip. We only need to eliminate the other four choices.<n><n>#### A: Guard House<n><n>The first two words, 'guard house' are redundant. How the geese get from place A to place B is their primary concern.<n><n>### B: Carried by people<n><n>Since this question refers to geese, not duck, we can rule out choices that say guard or carried by people.<n>Also, the second part of the question says, 'They normally fly from place...'<n>If carried by people were an option, then why would the geese have to rely on flying?<n><n>### C: Fly<n><n>If this were correct, there would be no need for us to read the second part of the sentence.<n><n>### E: Group together<n><n>The question says that they normally fly, not group together.<n><n>#### D: Follow Ultralight airplane<n><n>The word normally means that this is a regular occurrence, and we should not expect that the geese are on an ultralight airplanes on a semi-regular basis.<n><n>```<n>> 4/14/2017  <n>> -0-          -310/          -417/          -430/          -480/<n>> -156        -256          -1260/          -0-          -10<n>> -220/          -356          -116/          -310<n>> 4/8/2017     +4<n>> +8            +0-          -0-          +8/          +144<n>> 3              15             9/          -18<n>> -0-         +4<n>> 430/          +56<n>$$<n>```<n><n>### Answer:<n>They normally fly<n>

Choices:  A: child's hand B: the last straw C: hobby shop D: end of line E: toy store<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Rationales:In the sentence: She thought that there was a more string on the spole.... The spole is a roll of something, like toothpaste and tissues, that are coiled up into a round or oval shape. So it's reasonable to guess, that this is referring to string, since it is used a lot in making objects with lines, like kites and clothes. In the sentence: The spole slipped out of he fingre... The key here is the word fingre or finger, and this refers to her hand, since the kite was tied on to her hand.<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Demostration :<n>### Rational : <n><n>### Input :How many 3 digit numbers are there?<n>### Response :<n><n>### Rationale:<n>You must count all three digits, the first one, the second one, the third one...<n>So for exemple, it would be :<n>133...<n>132...<n>100. etc. that would count as one three digit number.<n><n>### Rules:<n><n>1. if the number is 1 digit it will not count<n>2. if the number is two digits, it will need two 0 to make it 3 digits<n>3. if the number is three digits, it will need one to make it 4 digits so it does not count anymore.

I need to know your thoughts in order to improve the question.<n><n>## Exercise 1:Answer the following:<n><n>### Instructions:<n>What is the value of x?<n><n>```tex<n>    \begin{pre}<n>x = <<-31+1>>31 + 1<n>\end{pre}<n><n>```<n><n>### Answers:<n>### 18<n>### Demonstation:<n>For this answer there isn't any solution.<n>### Answer 2:<n>#### 28<n>### Demosnation:<n>\[25\times\color{red}{( } \mathit{x}\color{green)})\] =  \mathit{} [ 7( x)\color{green)}]x = [[25\color{red}{(}  \mathit{x)\color{green)} } ]( x)\color{blue)} ]( \color{red}{  \mathit{[ 7(x)\color{green) }}} )( \color{blue){x} ] \]<n><n>```tex<n>\verb| |      \hspace{3.5mm}   \\<n><n>$\hspace{3.5 mm}$<n>$\hspace{3mm}$ \verb|| ||          \\<n>\ \\ \\  \\  \\  \\   \\     \\      \\<n>\ \\    . \\ \\.... \ \\      \\\\      \\\\      \\<n>\\   \\\\      \    \\      \\  \      \<n><n>```<n><n>\[\ 1  \color{blue){3=1+9=19}\]<n><n>### Answer 3:<n>\[x\color{red}{( )}\] = $8(x)$<n><n>```tex<n><n>\verb||||<n>$\\<n>\  +\\   \\<n>\  \ \\  + \ \\ \\ \\ \  \  \ \\ \   \\ \\ \<n>\\  \\  \\  \ \     \\   \\\\ \<n>\  \\ \\ \   \\  \\  \\ \ \\  \\ \<n><n>\ \\ \<n>\  \\ \  \ \\  \  \  \<n>\  \\  \\ <n>\
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What could listening to music cause you to be? Choices:  A: happy B: smile C: calm D: entertainment E: relaxation<n><n>### Response:		Answer to this question:<n>Both A and D would be correct. Some songs can make you happy while others can be relaxing.<n>#### A<n>A: happy<n><n>### Input and response:<n><n>[**Mary**](### ) told me that she wants to have a good dinner. Is that realistic, or does the dinner need to be cheaper?<n>(A) Cheaper<n>```<n>Answer: Realistic<n>```<n><n>Input and response:<n>```<n>My friend, **Adam**, wants to save $100 in order to go to the baseball game on Friday. He tells me that he wants to avoid spending any money on food and drinks on Thursday because he plans to eat and drink at the baseball game. Will he be able to afford to go to the baseball tickets by avoiding spending money on food and drink on Thursday?<n>(A) Yes, if he avoids spending any money on anything else<n>```<n><n>Answer: No, because the cost of the baseball tickets is not an expense he is trying to avoid. Since the cost of the tickets is $20, he needs to spend $180 on food and drink in order to afford it.<n>```<n>In this situation, Mary could afford it so long as she avoided every expense except eating<n>```<n><n>A friend called to tell me about her new home. The total rent is $700 while it takes her 70 minutes to travel each way to get there by bus. The bus fare is the same as the walking fare and it costs $9 for a bus and $8 to walk.<n>In which of the following situations would she afford the rent every month?<n>   (A) Walking home from the bus does not take more than 70 minutes.<n>```<n>Answer: A will not work for Mary<n><n>Walking home adds up to exactly the same as riding the bus, so the walk is not saving any money. The total travel time, which includes bus time and walk time, is 70 minutes, so it will never take long enough to justify renting her new residence even if she walks.<n>```<n><n>### Input<n>What could **Zora** do when she has 52 hours, 45 minutes to finish her assignment?<n>Choices: {A: Finish the assignment, B: Find

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. Choices:  A: sights B: optical illusion C: optical telescope D: light microscope E: binocular<n><n>### Response:		What is the appropriate name for the situation where you have seen something through a device to examine it more clearly? Choices: A: A: sights B. optical illusion C: The Optical Telescope D: The Binocular E optical microscope<n><n>### Demostrating<n>If you go to the optometrist, they will examine your eyes with special equipment. In case you cannot see things clearly, they may use glasses or lenses with eyeglasses that magnify what's in front of your eyes. This is known as an "optical telescope".<n><n>### Solution:<n>A: optical telescope<n><n>### Solution Explanation:<n>While an optical telescope magnifies what is seen through it, the correct term for such a situation is an optical telescope.<n>On the other hand, binoculars can magnify, but would be used to bring things that are farther away into a sharper image. Optical illusions are created when you are not looking clearly at something, and sights would refer to the equipment that an optometrist uses in their practice. A microscope will focus things that are smaller in size and an illusion is something that creates things to appear differently than they truly are.<n><n>### Answer: optical telescope<n>

How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What is necessary for learning by yourself? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:John loved competing because he was very competitive. Write an equation and 3 real numbers.<n>\Rationales: The ocarina's width is 9+ 12 cm or 21 cm. Let x be the width, so that the width of the other side will be x.<n><n>$\bar{x} + 12 = 21 \to {x^2 + 12x + 121=0}$$<n><n>$\overline {(-x+\sqrt {121})} = \overline {(-2 x +{\sqrt {121}})}$<n><n>$\sqrt {(-x+\sqrt{121} )}=(-2 x + \sqrt{121}) $\<n><n>$(-x + \sqrt{108} )=(-2 x + \ \sqrt{122}) $<n><n>$x+{ (-\ \sqrt {108} )}=2 y + \ \sqrt {122}$<n><n>$x={ (-\ \sqrt {47} )} + \y + \ \sqrt{41}$<n><n>$x=(-

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. Choices:  A: further cause B: wave goodbye C: attempt suicide D: insulting them E: thank god<n><n>### Response:		Choose one answer from the following.<n><n>* A. <<A=Further Cause>><n>* B. <<B=Wave Goodbye>><n>* C. <<C=Insult Them>><n>* D. <<D=Thank God>><n>* E. <<E=Wave Good Bye>><n><n>### Answer: C. <<Insult Them;I.e.Choose Insult>><n><n>### Clarification:The person leaving is going to the other side of the room, not the entire world.<n><n>### Input The following sentences are displayed for 2 seconds each. The first sentence is displayed for 4 seconds, and the second is displayed for 5 seconds. The sentences are identical, except the second sentence is missing one letter. Based on the information below, choose the letter that is missing from the second sentence. Choices: A. h B. t C. e D. g E. r<n><n>### Response The following is an example (the two sentences are identical, except that one letter is missing):<n><n>* sentence 1 is <<S1. Sleep is good for you and healthy for your body. S2. Sleep is good and healthy for your bod.>><n>* sentence 2 is <<S3. Sleep is good. and Sleep is good for your bod.>>.<n><n>### Answer B.<n><n>### Clarifications:<n><n>#### Why does the second sentence say "Sleep is good and" instead of "Sleep is good"? Why is the second sentence missing the letter "and"?<n>1. After you choose the letter, there is a 2 second wait before you see the answer on your screen. The time between each sentence is exactly 2 seconds. <n>2. <<Cut the time between presenting the sentences to only 1 second>><n>### Rationale for answer:<n>The letter "e" is missing from the second section. The word "sleep" begins with the letter "S", just as the sentence displayed. The second sentence begins with the letter "e", so the letter "e" is the correct choice to choose.<n><n>### Choices and Rationales:<n><n>#### Choice 1: The answer is B<n><n>The word "sleep" begins the sentence, and the sentence displays the letter "n" to indicate that it is the same word.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Someone lacking immortality will one day be? Choices:  A: kick the bucket B: mortal C: dead D: can die E: dying<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### E<n>Answer:<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>#### 211<n><n>Answer: 211<n>

Hair salons that cater to men are often called barber shops. Hair-related products are also made in barber shops. Women do not usually get their hair cut in barber shops, so a barber shop would not have clips for women to borrow. Hairy places do not have pins to clip their hair to their heads. Pincushions are made to store pins. <n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:When would you be able to see your reflection in a piece of wood? Choices:  A: burned B: polished C: carved D: composted E: nailed<n><n>### Response:		You would be able to see your reflected in the wood if it is burned. After the wood is burned, you would be able to see the reflection of your eye, nose, mouth and teeth.<n>### Rationale:You would not be able to see your reflections is any other choice, and you would not be able to do it in the last two choices because you do not put a mirror in a piece of wood after you carve or nail it.<n><n>In your own words:In the instruction a reflected in a piece of wood is not possible unless the wood has been burned. This is because of the material that the wood is made up of. When a piece of wood is burned the material is destroyed, making it possible to see the reflection. If I was given the same instruction I would chose to answer the question with the same reasoning as given in the example above.<n>

It is not something someone would say, since "Bobcat" is a single word and not a name.<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>

How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:If I want to maximize my number of potential customers, where should I build a new department store? Choices:  A: idaho B: shopping mall C: big city D: in town E: new york<n><n>### Response:		<n>A)<n><n>### Rationale:<n>Most people do not have a lot of money. They like to get a new dress if it has lots of discount. The location is very important and it also shows the quality of the products.<n>

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Rationales: 8 hours * 3 = <<8*3=24>>24 hours<n>5.5 * 2 = <<5.5*2=11>>11 hours<n>24 + 11 = <<24+11=35>>35 hours<n>35/7 = <<35/7=5>>5 hours<n>Lawrence would work 5 hours each of the 7 days in a week.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. Choices:  A: automobile accidents B: backache C: eye strain D: getting tired E: car crash<n><n>### Response:		B.<n><n>### Answer: B<n><n>### Rationales:<n><n>### Choice A is incorrect because driving a car can not cause an automobile accident.<n><n>### Choices B, C, and D are all incorrect because these do not happen during a car ride but after the ride has ended.<n><n>### Driving a car and getting tired are the same because both cause car drivers to be tired after a long and stressful drive.<n><n>### Thus, choice E is the answer.<n><n>### ##<n><n>## Instructions:<n>Now add some additional comments. Write a response that uses the information in the text together with your knowledge of arithmetic to indicate a course of action.<n>Input: There are 40 children in a classroom. If half of the girls are 50% of the class, then 5/8ths of the boys are in the gym at the same time, and a full 63% of the students are not sick, how much does the average age of the classroom have to be so that the average age of each classroom is exactly 13.2?<n>Rationales:: In a classroom, the number of students can be modeled by a formula, or the number of girls. We can find the number of girls by multiplying the number of girls in the classroom by 50%<n>:<n>20*50% = <<20*50%=10>>10 girls<n><n>We also know that 2/3 of the classroom are boys and are in the gym, so the number of boys in the gym is:<n>20*2/3 =<<20*2/->3=6>> 6 Boys<n><n>We also know there are 8 gyms, so the number of children in the gym is 6/8 =2/4<n><n>The last part of the question, where the question asks what type of child is not sick, requires us to subtract 2/4 from the group of 63% children.<n>Thus, 63% - 2/4 = ((1-2/4)/100*20) = <<63-2/4=(20)*(->5->=1-2/4>>5 -2/4)<n><n>Since 40 X 9 = 360, we can solve:<n>\begin{code}<n><n>(1-2/4/100*360<n>\end{code}= <<(->5->=360)=((1-2/4)=((360)*5)<n>\end{code})<n>Finally, we divide by 100/1 to get:<n><n>\begin{code}%<n>= <<1-((360)*2/8)>>5 143

How many books were not sold?<n>Rationales: We look first for the total number of books that were sold: 60 + 10 + 20 + 44 + 66 = <<60+10+20+44+66=200>>200 books.<n>So the total number of books that were not sold is: 800 – 200 = <<800-200=600>>600 books.<n>#### 600<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Jimmy didn't like going to the party. Choices:  A: dance B: getting drunk C: meet new people D: having fun E: have fun<n><n>### Response:		None of these answers.<n><n>#### None of these answers<n>Answer: None of these answers<n>Rationales: Jimmy says he isn't having a good time because he isn't "having fun." He goes to the party to have fun and not to get drunk, dance, or meet new people.<n><n>### Input：<n>Which of these numbers is not prime：<n><n>### Response：<n>256<n><n>### Answer:<n>None of these answers<n>Answer None of these answers Rationales: 452 is prime because it is not divisible by any other whole number besides one and itself.<n>2 is prime 539 is prime because it is the only number less than 15 prime and it is not divisible any of the whole number.<n>214 is not prime<n><n>### Input<n>Samuel can bang his head as many times as he wants but he can’t bang his head after 2pm<n><n>### Response<n>1<n><n>### Answer<n>Samuel is the best person in the world<n>Answer: Samuel is the best person in this world.<n><n>### Rationales<n>Samuel can bangs his head as many times but he can't bangs his head after 2 pm because he can't do it again.<n><n>### Answer：<n><n>Jonny had 4, 8 and 9 pencils in his bag.  He lost 2 pencils on Friday and 3 pencils on Saturday.  He still had 1 pencil on Sunday. How many pencils does Jonny now have in his bag?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Rationale<n>He had 4+8+9 = 21 pencils in his back on Friday.<n>He lost 2 pencil on Friday+3 pencils on saturday.<n>21 - 5 = 16 left on Sunday. 16 is a divisible by 4.<n><n>### A response：<n>The boys were not going to camp with anything<n><n>### Rationaels：<n>Brad and Randy got a problem 。Brad said that they couldn’t bring anything.
